critique: This document is an executive order amending a previous executive order regarding representation and post allowances for government officials. It specifies restrictions on how these allowances can be used, citing specific US Code sections. There is nothing to suggest a strong ideological tilt. It does not address immigration. It does not substantially expand executive power, but rather clarifies existing regulations. It does not obviously relate to federalism. It does not directly address national security or civil liberties. It imposes some restrictions on spending, but not in a way that strongly regulates the economy. It does not directly address social inclusion.
